content.prompt: A particle with a small electric charge is moved in an electric field by an external force. When the particle is moved along an electric potential isoline, in what direction, if any, is the force exerted by the electric field on the particle?

choices.label: In the same direction as the particle’s motion
Opposite to the direction of the particle’s motion
Perpendicular to the direction of the particle’s motion
In no direction, since no force is exerted on a particle moving parallel to an isoline

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
